content.description: Climb up to the juggy rail.  Traverse to the right on said rail.  Clip chains.
content.location: The route runs out the Left side of Snakes Roof.

content.description: Short, overhung route. Finishes at the scooped out dish just right of snakes roof.
content.location: Far left route of Royal Arches wall. 15 feet right of Goin' Rogue.

content.description: WOW! This one is hard. Moderate climbing to the third bolt takes you to a difficult boulder problem with a sloper from your nightmares.
content.location: The bolt line directly to the right of “Umbrella Girl”.

climbs.name: Here Come the Snakes
climbs.fa: Dave Groth, Rich Bechler & Rob Drysdale. 1990.

content.location: This route goes right out the middle of Snakes Roof.
On Arete between Feathered Serpent & Umbrella Girls

content.description: Pull a few moves to get under the roof, set up for the huge crux throw, pull a couple more tough moves out the roof, then fight the pump at the sloper finish before the chains.
content.location: This route goes out the right hand side of the roof.

content.description: Start laying on your back at the base of the climb. Kick a foot as high as you can into the offwidth; your invert has begun. Work through a tough situp move into a large hand stack (or lie it back if you don't offwidth crack boulder much). Extricate your feet and swing upright, watch out for the dab! Don't mess with the snake in the crack, you'll die.
content.protection: None. Would take a #6 or a buried #5 cam if you had to. Just run it out.
content.location: Find Snakes roof. Turn around and look at the ground about 5 feet behind you. :thumbs up:

content.description: Traverse along the crack parallel to the ground till you reach the jug rail on Who Let the Snakes Out, keep going on the rail till you reach another bolt on the 12c, then clip the anchors.
content.protection: Varied. small stuff till you reach the bolt.
content.location: Far left side of snakes roof is where the traverse begins. The route ends on the anchors of "here come the snakes"

content.description: Snakes Roof is the obvious roof that you come to right after passing Lovely Tower on your way to Hidden Peaks.  The roof itself has Three excellent lines, characterized by big moves on good holds.
